# Andrew

**The Quiet Connector**

**Strengths:** Humble, relational, observant

**Role in God’s Story:** Andrew brings people to Jesus—even his brother Peter. He’s not loud, but his steady presence and relational faithfulness leave a big impact.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [John 1:35–42](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+1%3A35-42&version=NIV) – First to follow Jesus and invites Peter
* [John 6:8–9](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+6%3A8-9&version=NIV) – Brings the boy with loaves and fish
* [John 12:20–22](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+12%3A20-22&version=NIV) – Introduces Greek seekers to Jesus

----

# James (Son of Zebedee)

**The Thunderstorm**

**Strengths:** Passionate, brave, willing to take risks

**Role in God’s Story:** James' fiery spirit becomes courage for the Kingdom. He’s one of the first to follow Jesus and the first apostle martyred. He shows us how zeal can become bold sacrifice.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Mark 1:19–20](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Mark+1%3A19-20&version=NIV) – Called by Jesus with his brother John
* [Luke 9:28–36](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+9%3A28-36&version=NIV) – Witnesses the Transfiguration
* [Mark 5:37](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Mark+5%3A37&version=NIV) – Present at the raising of Jairus' daughter
* [Mark 14:32–33](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Mark+14%3A32-33&version=NIV) – Prays with Jesus in Gethsemane

---

# Joanna

**The Faithful Advocate**

**Strengths:** Generous, courageous, influential

**Role in God’s Story:** Joanna uses her resources to support Jesus and courageously shows up at the tomb. She models quiet power and faithful presence.

**Where she shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Luke 8:1–3](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+8%3A1-3&version=NIV) – Supports Jesus’ ministry
* [Luke 24:1–10](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+24%3A1-10&version=NIV) – Among the women who discover the empty tomb

---

# John

**The Empathetic Soul**

**Strengths:** Loyal, emotionally attuned, loving

**Role in God’s Story:** John stays close to Jesus and helps us understand divine love through his gospel and letters. He models how intimacy with Jesus can deepen faith and compassion.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Mark 9:2–8](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Mark+9%3A2-8&version=NIV) – Present at the Transfiguration
* [John 13:21–26](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+13%3A21-26&version=NIV) – Reclines next to Jesus at the Last Supper
* [John 19:25–27](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+19%3A25-27&version=NIV) – Stays at the cross
* [John 20:1–9](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+20%3A1-9&version=NIV) – Runs to the empty tomb

---

# Martha

**The Responsible Doer**

**Strengths:** Dependable, practical, candid

**Role in God’s Story:** Martha serves others with care and speaks honestly with Jesus. Her faith opens the door to one of the boldest declarations of belief in the Gospels.

**Where she shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Luke 10:38–42](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+10%3A38-42&version=NIV) – Welcomes Jesus and worries over many things
* [John 11:17–27](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+11%3A17-27&version=NIV) – Confesses her belief in Jesus as Messiah

---

# Mary Magdalene

**The Fierce Loyalist**

**Strengths:** Courageous, faithful, devoted

**Role in God’s Story:** Mary Magdalene follows Jesus through His darkest moments and is the first to witness the resurrection. Her life is a testimony to the healing and transformation that comes from love.

**Where she shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Luke 8:1–3](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+8%3A1-3&version=NIV) – Delivered from demons and follows Jesus
* [Mark 15:40–41](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Mark+15%3A40-41&version=NIV) – Present at the crucifixion
* [John 20:11–18](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+20%3A11-18&version=NIV) – Sees the risen Jesus

---

# Mary of Bethany

**The Deep Listener**

**Strengths:** Worshipful, reflective, intuitive

**Role in God’s Story:** Mary pauses to sit at Jesus’ feet and pour perfume on Him in worship. She reminds us that presence with Jesus matters more than performance.

**Where she shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Luke 10:38–42](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+10%3A38-42&version=NIV) – Sits at Jesus’ feet while Martha serves
* [John 11:28–35](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+11%3A28-35&version=NIV) – Weeps at Lazarus’ tomb with Jesus
* [John 12:1–8](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+12%3A1-8&version=NIV) – Anoints Jesus with perfume

---

# Matthew

**The Changed Outsider**

**Strengths:** Detail-oriented, reflective, redeemed

**Role in God’s Story:** A former tax collector turned disciple, Matthew shows that grace rewrites your story. He documents Jesus’ life with care, emphasizing His authority and compassion.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Matthew 9:9–13](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+9%3A9-13&version=NIV) – Called by Jesus and hosts a dinner for other outsiders
* [Matthew 10:1–4](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+10%3A1-4&version=NIV) – Listed among the twelve apostles

---

# Nathanael (Bartholomew)

**The Straight Shooter**

**Strengths:** Honest, perceptive, sincere

**Role in God’s Story:** Nathanael speaks his mind but responds wholeheartedly to truth. He reminds us that God honors integrity and quick recognition of His presence.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [John 1:45–51](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+1%3A45-51&version=NIV) – Initially skeptical, but quickly confesses Jesus as the Son of God

---

# Peter (Simon Peter)

**The Bold Leader**

**Strengths:** Courageous, passionate, quick to act

**Role in God’s Story:** Peter’s impulsiveness becomes bold leadership. He fails, learns, and becomes the rock of the early church. He reminds us that even imperfect faith can be world-changing when anchored in love.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Matthew 4:18–20](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+4%3A18-20&version=NIV) – Called by Jesus while fishing
* [Matthew 14:22–33](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+14%3A22-33&version=NIV) – Walks on water
* [Luke 22:54–62](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+22%3A54-62&version=NIV) – Denies Jesus three times
* [John 21:15–19](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+21%3A15-19&version=NIV) – Restored and commissioned by Jesus

---

# Philip

**The Practical Problem Solver**

**Strengths:** Logical, helpful, analytical

**Role in God’s Story:** Philip is practical and sincere—he wants to understand and explain. He reminds us that curiosity and reason can walk alongside faith.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [John 1:43–46](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+1%3A43-46&version=NIV) – Personally invited by Jesus and invites Nathanael
* [John 6:5–7](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+6%3A5-7&version=NIV) – Calculates the cost of feeding 5,000
* [John 14:8–9](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+14%3A8-9&version=NIV) – Asks Jesus to show them the Father

---

# Simon the Zealot

**The Revolutionary**

**Strengths:** Passionate, committed, transformed

**Role in God’s Story:** Simon likely came from a radical political background, but Jesus transforms his zeal into devotion and peace. His story reminds us that passion, when surrendered, can fuel the Kingdom.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [Luke 6:12–16](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+6%3A12-16&version=NIV) – Listed as one of the twelve apostles
* [Matthew 10:1–4](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+10%3A1-4&version=NIV) – Included among the original disciples

---

# Thomas

**The Honest Skeptic**

**Strengths:** Thoughtful, courageous, truth-seeking

**Role in God’s Story:** Thomas voices his doubts openly and finds faith deeply. His journey reminds us that questions are welcome and can lead to greater belief.

**Where he shows up in the Gospels:**

* [John 11:16](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+11%3A16&version=NIV) – Offers to go with Jesus to Jerusalem, even if it means death
* [John 14:5–6](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+14%3A5-6&version=NIV) – Asks Jesus to explain the way
* [John 20:24–29](https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John+20%3A24-29&version=NIV) – Doubts the resurrection until he sees Jesus
